content: ok <@1242765652297650288> I looked for a #plugins or #skills channel and didn't see it, the whole idea of posting to this server in the first place was from Opus itself. author: jackreis#0

content:
No, everything that someone has created generally has to go into <#1281536652254384159> no matter what. 

Then if someone is interested, or it's relevant to the discussion, you can share a link to your post in <#1281536652254384159> in reply to them. They discourage reposting it in more than one place, and favor you simply linking to your one post.

i am running the 200 MAX subscription plan, but I am seeing a lot of 429 errors wen i run a bunch of sessions in non-interactive mode.  I would be surpised if i am reach 20M tokens per hour but how are people handling this. I would've though that the cli itself would pause and try the request again. 

```
API Error: 429 {"type":"error","error":{"type":"rate_limit_error","message":"This request would exceed the rate limit for your organization (a22d2e13-60c7-4fc2-b9fa-84c2ebda1ff1) of 20,000,000 prompt bytes per hour. For details, refer to: https://doc
```
